page.title: 04SILAGE & HAY
page.content: Silage is fermented grass and hay is dried grass.The time to cut silage is before the seed heads apppear.When the farmer gives the O.K. they start cutting the grass .then it is caught up in the forage-harvester and it's thrown back into the trailer.When the trailer is full another tractor comes with an empty one .They swap trailers and the tractor with the full trailer goes back to the farm and tips the silage (freshly cut grass) into its pit or heap. Hay is cut when the seed heads are ripe.It must be absolutely dry.Then you bale it.When you have baled it you collect the bales and store it in a barn. Both silage and hay are used as winter feed for sheep and cattle.
